subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Another reason is that there isn t anything in the JUnit contract that says that test instances can t be reused to rerun the test. I believe some tools
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> ..because as soon as they try to do the same thing on
> another xUnit platform, notably NUnit, they will find
> only [SetUp] and [TearDown] do what they expected.

Another reason is that there isn't anything in the JUnit
contract that says that test instances can't be reused to
rerun the test. I believe some tools (JPerfTest comes to
mind) will re-run the same test instance over-and-over; GUI
tools could do the same as well. I've also seen a remote
test runner where tests are serialized across the wire
(serialization, of course, bypasses normal initialisation
rules, so you'll lose any transient fields).

Obeying the setUp() and tearDown() is the way to ensure that
your test work, as expected, in all JUnit based tools.
